title: Can you solve the three gods riddle? - Alex Gendler

multiple-choice.question: You and your team have crash-landed on an ancient planet and must appease its three alien overlords, Tee, Eff, and Arr, by giving them the correct artifacts. Unfortunately, you don't know who is who. From an inscription, you learn that you may ask three yes or no questions, each addressed to any one lord. Tee's answers are always true, Eff's are always false, and Arr's answer is random each time. But there's a problem. You've deciphered the language enough to ask any question, but you don't know which of the two words 'ozo' and 'ulu' means yes and which means no. What is the key to figuring out which alien is which?

options.label: A
options.text: Asking direct questions to each alien.

options.label: B
options.text: Including the words 'ozo' and 'ulu' in the questions.

options.label: C
options.text: Asking questions that are true or false.

options.label: D
options.text: Asking questions that are hypothetical and loaded with conditions.

multiple-choice.question: You ask the alien in the middle, "If I asked you whether the overlord on my left is Arr, would you answer 'ozo'?" If the reply is 'ozo', what can you be sure of?

options.label: A
options.text: You are talking to Arr.

options.label: B
options.text: The overlord on the right is Arr.

options.label: C
options.text: The overlord on the left is Arr.

options.label: D
options.text: The alien on the right is not Arr.

multiple-choice.question: If you ask the alien you've determined is not Arr, "If I asked 'are you Eff?' would you answer 'ozo'?", what can you be sure of?

options.label: A
options.text: The alien is Tee.

options.label: B
options.text: The alien is Eff.

options.label: C
options.text: Either answer will establish its identity.

options.label: D
options.text: You will still be unsure.

multiple-choice.question: What is the process of elimination that will identify the remaining alien?

options.label: A
options.text: Asking Tee if it's a long way to Earth.

options.label: B
options.text: Asking Arr if it's a long way to Earth.

options.label: C
options.text: Asking Eff if it's a long way to Earth.

options.label: D
options.text: Asking the center overlord if it's Arr.

multiple-choice.question: After identifying the remaining alien, what is the final question you ask Tee?

options.label: A
options.text: If I asked you whether the center overlord is Arr, would you answer 'ozo'?

options.label: B
options.text: If I asked you whether the overlord on my left is Eff, would you answer 'ozo'?

options.label: C
options.text: If I asked you whether it's a long way to Earth, would you answer 'ozo'?

options.label: D
options.text: If I asked you whether I am Tee, would you answer 'ozo'?

options.label: C
options.text: The Internet

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Where are the baby dinosaurs?

multiple-choice.question: What is the main theme of the speaker's talk, "Shape-shifting Dinosaurs: The cause of a premature extinction"?

options.label: B
options.text: Dinosaurs were too small and too similar.

options.label: C
options.text: Dinosaurs were too diverse and went extinct prematurely.

options.label: D
options.text: Dinosaurs were too uniform and didn't go extinct.

multiple-choice.question: Why did scientists have a hard time finding juvenile dinosaurs in museums?

options.label: A
options.text: They were too small to be seen.

options.label: B
options.text: They were too rare to be collected.

options.label: C
options.text: Everyone wanted to collect the big ones, leaving the little ones behind.

options.label: D
options.text: They were too fragile to be handled.

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of the discovery of juvenile Triceratops in the Hell Creek Formation?

options.label: A
options.text: It helped to prove that Triceratops and Torosaurus were the same animal.

options.label: B
options.text: It showed that Triceratops had a more complex frill than previously thought.

options.label: C
options.text: It demonstrated that Triceratops went through a growth series, with juvenile and adult stages.

options.label: D
options.text: It confirmed that Triceratops was a plant-eating dinosaur.

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between Pachycephalosaurus, Stygimoloch, and Dracorex?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: They are three different genera of dinosaurs.

options.label: C
options.text: They are three growth stages of the same dinosaur species.

options.label: D
options.text: They are three unrelated dinosaurs that lived at the same time.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the speaker's research on the dinosaurs in the Hell Creek Formation?

options.label: A
options.text: The number of dinosaur species has increased by 10.

options.label: B
options.text: The number of dinosaur species has decreased by 10.

options.label: C
options.text: The number of dinosaur species has remained the same.

options.label: D
options.text: The research has confirmed that all dinosaurs in the Hell Creek Formation are extinct.

title: What is bipolar disorder? - Helen M. Farrell

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: How super glue was invented | Moments of Vision 8 - Jessica Oreck

multiple-choice.question: In the 1940s, Harry Coover was working on a project to produce precision gunsights for the military using a family of chemicals called cyanoacrylates. What was the problem they encountered with these chemicals?

options.label: A
options.text: They were too brittle and prone to shattering.

options.label: B
options.text: They were too soft and prone to melting.

options.label: C
options.text: They stuck to everything permanently.

options.label: D
options.text: They were too expensive to produce.

multiple-choice.question: After the war, Harry Coover was working on a project to develop heat-resistant polymers for jet airplane canopies. What did he and his team try, and what was the problem they encountered?

options.label: A
options.text: They tried heat-resistant metals, but found them to be too heavy.

options.label: B
options.text: They tried heat-resistant plastics, but found them to be too brittle.

options.label: C
options.text: They tried cyanoacrylates, but found that they stuck to everything permanently.

options.label: D
options.text: They tried heat-resistant ceramics, but found them to be too expensive.

multiple-choice.question: In a moment of vision, Harry Coover realized that the quality that made the cyanoacrylates so infuriating to work with was actually what made them valuable. What was this quality?

options.label: A
options.text: Their ability to conduct heat.

options.label: B
options.text: Their ability to conduct electricity.

options.label: C
options.text: Their ability to stick to surfaces.

options.label: D
options.text: Their ability to resist corrosion.

multiple-choice.question: During the Vietnam War, field medics discovered a new use for super glue. What was it?

options.label: A
options.text: It was used to seal wounds and prevent infection.

options.label: B
options.text: It was used to cauterize wounds and stop bleeding.

options.label: C
options.text: It was used to stitch wounds shut and promote healing.

options.label: D
options.text: It was used to disinfect wounds and prevent infection.

multiple-choice.question: Today, super glue is used in a variety of applications, including surgery and household repairs. What is one of the key benefits of using super glue in these situations?

options.label: A
options.text: It is extremely expensive and hard to find.

options.label: B
options.text: It is extremely difficult to apply and requires special training.

options.label: C
options.text: It is extremely effective at bonding surfaces and stopping bleeding.

options.label: D
options.text: It is extremely toxic and requires special handling.
